verbatim_example: Tried to cold turkey but failed
I used to subscribe to /r/opiates but recently have been finding the content too provocative while trying to stop
I've been told the upside to Meth is that it still provides some of that opiate comfort, effectively occupying that part of my brain that is always screaming into my life to satisfy it.

I've been told the upside to Meth is that it still provides some of that opiate comfort, effectively occupying that part of my brain that is always screaming into my life to satisfy it. *Wouldn't that be just as temporary as my first bag? Won't I eventually need more and more for the same comfort? Will I be stuck on it forever, lose all my teeth and constantly be slightly sweaty? Isn't it like having an unsatisfying hit, like you can feel something but need more to be satisfied?*
Does anyone know what dangers there are with this (aside from obvious IV related dangers), based on facts or direct experience?
fear a benzo rattle could push me
Being alive and awake feel like a chore. A pain. A challenge with no reward. The more I think about it, the more I hope I won't wake up in the morning. This is turning into suicidal fantasy.
heroin always takes me to a much darker hell than whatever I'm trying to run from

I didn't sleep for a 4 day span, and now sleep on and off an hour at a time. My thinking is still foggy from the Kratom, but it doesn't do much in regards to anxiety. Right now I imagine that the benzo W/Ds are still most of it, but because I have put myself through so much mental anguish, I don't know if I am simply creating anxiety.

I quit opiates/benzos/adderall 12 days ago, now I am trying to stabilize on Kratom... I get so easily over-whelmed, and that feeling is really magnified when I stop dosing... it feels like my blood pressure is through the roof, it messes with my vision and I sweat non-stop
I only sleep hour stints, last week I was up for 4 days straight. Everything bothers me... Going outside feels so terrifying, esp when I am physically shaking and in constant cold sweats.

Things get out of control quickly when you wake up to realize you have two monkeys on your back... The first two weeks were absolutely brutal, I could barely function, I didn't sleep for a 4 day span, I was extremely paranoid, it truly was hell.
The withdrawal was really intense, I was stuck to my apartment for almost the entire 3 weeks
I know that drugs are temporary and make you worse off in the long run
The drugs kept me so numb to the pain
Drugs are a choice that turns into a disease. It rewires your brain into the desire and urge we call addiction.
Forced detox... Fucking terrified , I am in the thick of wd. I cant do this
can't handle the wrestless legs at night
I still haven't had the withdrawals I was expecting, no shitting water, no puking, no seizures (from benzo wd), no sweats. The wrestless legs still won't quit.
Now that I am clean, I can barely get out of bed bc back and knees are so bad
I am scared bc I know I will want to use. I am scared bc I am already in pain and want to use.
Still having restless legs, but my regular Dr says they're not related, which means that the only withdrawal symptom I had was insomnia
I am starting to really mourn for ten years I lost to oxycontin and Xanax. I wonder what my life would be like now if I would never have taken that first pill
I have 70 something days clean. She asks me if I want to shoot up with her. Just for today, I will not relapse. What about tomorrow tho.
My mom died of an opiate overdose. She suffered chronic pain, and like so many of us, got hooked.
I have been taking kratom since Tuesday to help withdrawal
Six months ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something
couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something to change the way I feel
seeing friends die from overdosing, hearing people I met in rehab have relapsed and are living on the street
a year ago I was in a hospital bed with a Staff Infection and Pneumonia; I was making plans to go pick up the second I got out...What a difference a year can make
Iâ€™m officially one year clean from opiates

60-100mg habit, 1.75 year habit with some clean time mixed in. My last pill connect entered rehab last week. All ties are cut and I'm moving forward in my life. Too much ahead of me this year to have those pills looming over me.
Few emotional spells, morning GI subsided, Dropping the Lope to 6mg today, dropping the Benzo to .25mg today and .75mg tonight before bed

felt pretty bad. The evening was fine following that until the later part of the night. I don't think I slept but 30-45 mins last night. This morning I feel like a walking emotional zombie at work. Shed a lot of tears this morning and felt pretty pathetic.
Sleep was total shit and so is this morning. Right now feels so discouraging
One week down, working on day 8. So far I haven't been a huge crybaby like yesterday. Instead it's just a emotional void, no good or bad. I'll take that over just bad.
Still have the morning GI lingering around but the malaise is still the biggest pain in the ass

I still cry like a baby sometimes but less frequently. I still blow up the bathroom in the morning but it doesn't persist all day. I still can't sleep well but I'm grabbing more random spurts of it. I still feel emotionally flatlined but I've caught myself laughing a few times this week and joking with others.

This shit isn't easy... but that shouldn't be the reason you don't stop using. It's not supposed to be easy, you're trying to rescue your hijacked brain and body from something that's held it hostage for however long.

Still having gnarly morning GI that tapers off. Still can't totally relax without some restless feet. Lingering anhedonia that comes in waves. Still sorta anxious about the feeling of not enjoying day to day life things that I used to.

I can say that I have never had a craving in the 17 days up until that point. It hit me like a fuckin sack of bricks... started pouring sweat, plotting and rationalizing all the ways I could get around this security blanket that I've created, giving myself reasons as to why it would be okay
a few cases of the clammy sweats
Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits, anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs
Sunday morning the fog rolled back in. Emotional, tons of GI issues, anxiety sweats, depressed, stir crazy, irritable, restless. Felt like day 4 of withdrawals out of the blue.
Only things lingering around at 25 days are morning GI, restless sleep, anxiety/anhedonia waves
the cycle of withdrawal etc etc
My body/brain are feeling anxious, depressed and just out of sync compared to 27-30. Almost feels like days 7-11 again.
can't sleep. but I'm happy I've gone this long. I feel so much better than I thought I would. I have an appetite.

I have been off heroin for six days now, but last night and this morning i had an incredibly bad toothache. I mean I was literally writing in my bed in pain. My dad gave me a 7.5 hydrocodone. I didnt get high, but it did relieve the pain a lot.
I haven't been using for almost two months
Feel OK. Got lots of benzos just in case. And lope of course lol
I took many meant Xanax..... Even more klonopin. Half a bottle of Jamey and a snorted a fat bag. To my surprise I woke up hours later on the balcony covered in puke.
Achy. Zero sleep. But I feel so much better than just yesterday.
I was so fucked up on dope and xanax and kpins that i blacked out the entire way. Thats enough. I cant fucking do that anymore. It is humiliating. Degrading.
the longest I've been sober in a year at least
Almost got four days but I want to sleep so. Badly. I keep thinking just one more...
It's been a month and a half. I feel alive. ... It's amazing how much my life has changed for the better. I'm genuinely happy.

of course opiates aren't for everyone and they can ruin some people's lives

This is incredibly dangerous and stupid! You have no idea what kind of bacteria/infection/anything these people have in their piss! Do NOT put any piss back into your bladder! This is how you get a serious infection, fuck up your bladder, and become incontinent, and have to wear diapers the rest of your life.

the last 3 shipments I've gotten have all been tainted with something and have made both me and people close to me very ill. My sister even had to go to the hospital for whatever it was. All of us are okay now, but the sickness lasted about a week and included symptoms like incredibly high fever, delirium, really bad and burning shits, and general lethargicness.
When you're nodding hard on the couch

Multiple attempts at detoxing, multiple failures, rehab check ins that lasted 2 weeks had led me to believe that I was incapable
I know that there is no chance in hell that I can have any opiates without coming unhinged
This opiate habit struck me like a cancer. Suddenly I was very sick and I tried for over a year to pull myself up by the boot straps.  I was weak and helpless and insecure.

That phenomenon of craving is so fucking real, and there has never been any doubt that I'm a true-blue addict regarding these pills. I have nearly 6 months sober and although I haven't relapsed... I know in my heart that I would absolutely relapse if those things were in my possession.
Back up to my usual dose and acting like an addict again

the fact that time is so universally important in recovery can be beyond frustrating and discouraging, because you can't buy it... But I was not listening to the advice of my peers which was, in essence, that if you can give yourself enough clean time, you will arrive at a place that is remarkably different than the one you are in right now in your head.

the miserable cycle of using? How will that end. The best case scenario is that you donâ€™t OD, in which case you would just be using, getting sick, spending all of your money, always worrying, and surrounded by people who similarly only care about themselves- not because they are inherently bad people- but because they too are a slave to their own addiction.

These BILLION dollar pharmaceutical companies... are the same companies making the maintenance drugs for IF we can have the clarity to realize that something needs to change and decide to try to get clean. Itâ€™s almost as if they knew that they could create this cycle...

withdrawal is very similar to the flu... if someone who is on subs, methadone, or using, and has been wanting to jump off/get clean... Since you are already experiencing all of the terrible physical symptoms whether you like it or not
I was in recovery, and actually a year or so into it at that point. Iâ€™ll never forget it- constant memories of using and wanting to use. I really thought it might never end.

Lost and pulled under. You have to pull yourself out and dry out, shivering, on the bank. Until the sun comes out it's cold and miserable but you can't jump back in. There are only rocks and death in the water.

I needed it more than food in the morning. I can remember countless days choosing to obstain from eating in order to get another pill. If I did not dose every 5-6 hours the chills would set in, and I knew just how screwed I truley was.
So my advice is do not use sub long term unless your ready and willing to taper very slowly and truly have the self control to do so.
But I PROMISE YOU if you just STAY THE FUCK AWAY FROM OPIATES, and have a vision of what you want your life to look like.
